other_tests.findings: The liver has a nodular contour compatible with cirrhosis. There is no evidence of steatosis. The common bile duct measures 7 mm, with no intraductal filling defects. Gallstones in the gallbladder without gallbladder wall thickening. A 7 mm cystic lesion in the pancreatic head/uncinate process with no pancreatic ductal dilatation. The spleen is enlarged measuring 15.3 cm. Multiple small T2 hyperintense foci likely small renal cysts, and a 2.6 x 1.6 cm T2 hypointense lesion in the left kidney appearing stable in size. Prominent lymph nodes in the porta hepatis likely related to chronic liver disease.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The 2.6 x 1.6 cm T2 hypointense lesion in the left kidney appears stable in size going back to Not specified.
